intro: Phaca arrecta subsp. leibergii, commonly known as the Leiberg's fennel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. The subspecies leibergii is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and geographic distribution compared to the main species.
